body: If I increased the air temperature without increasing the radiant temperature, the red dot would fall off of the psych chart In a (to, x) chart, if you increase both the air temperature (**ta**) and the radiant temperature (**tr**), the red dot it moves to right because the operative temperature is directly proportional to **ta** and **tr**; [](http://api.ning.com:80/files/3dOMuCZtKjUt0CNeLsGuBEe*S5dFUdCv7LAIP5govHonJO26jtsU6LZ4U7Gn9ihjIpp3ITej2xZbYWkg*UdXpxITizDQNCKS/1.png) This happens also if you increase only one of the two temperatures (**ta** or **tr**).
